comment: Quizzes on lockdown browser/w cam and they were all unnecessarily hard. Even with answers identical to what's found in the worksheet, she'd still find a way to mark it wrong. She grades off of vibe, not accuracy. She takes up all the time with lecture and she will talk down to you and/or be passive aggressive for not knowing some things.

Your answers to her quizzes could be identical to what she said in her own lab manual as well as your peers, yet she'll still oddly mark your response wrong. Often made fun of students if they made a simple mistake in front of the entire class instead of teaching them how to improve. Honestly the worst and least caring professor I've had at KSU.

No lab reports. There are just 10 quizzes, which aren't too bad if you really study the lab manual beforehand, and 1 major lab assignment. Dr. Lu isn't the most compassionate professor, but she does take time to go over the material and makes sure you understand what you're doing. She might not be the best option, but I don't think she's terrible.

I would not wish this professor on my worst enemy. She refuses to post her lecture powerpoints online, her weekly quizzes all have the webcam on, her grading logic is inconsistent, and it's easy to set her off. Please avoid her at all costs.

Dr. Lu was just a sub for my micro lab this past week (thank God), and she is genuinely one of the rudest people I have ever met. You CANNOT DO ANYTHING RIGHT in her eyes. Even if you get the results you were looking for, she will find something to tell you that you still did wrong. Smartelic doesn't even do it justice. AVOID HER FOR ANY CLASS!!!

DO NOT TAKE HER!!! WORSE PROF AT KSU, NO EXAGGERATION. She cannot teach. Ask her questions n u are screwed she WILL yell at u n ask why u dont already know. Sometimes u need something repeated bc of her thick accent but nope she will take it as an offense. Her lab quizzes are graded so harshly, and have time limits, STUDY STUDY STUDY to do okay
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: When taking microbiology lab DO avoid. Whatever you do, do not take this professor. The material is not hard the hard part is getting over her grading. She is the most unfair grader there is in the history of KSU. If you do not put exactly what she would put in her words even if you get the answer right she will take off all credit. So unfair

If your goal is to fail, take her. You could know all the information, you could know all the answers, you will fail, and fail miserably. If your choice is to take her or wait a semester/ transfer do that, because you will fail and she will not listen to anything you have to say. Her responses are this class has a high failing rate.

Easily the worst professor Ive ever had in my life. She is so disorganized and rude. She is an extremely tough grader and will mark an open response question wrong if you put an extra space!! Her accent makes it hard to understand a word shes saying! She doesnt care about her students success whatsoever.

Of all the professors at Kennesaw, she should be your last option for ANY class. Shes unable to follow a schedule and didnt even cover 1/3 of the material for the year. Her grading is so indecisive, could give one person an A but someone else with a similar correct answer a C.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Shes a terrible professor! She obviously doesnt care about her students. Her grading is so ridiculous! I was a senior with a 4.0 gpa.. she ruined that. Only a couple of points away from an A because of her crazy grading on spelling and grammar. She doesnt bump. All of her microbio lab quizzes are ALL WRITTEN (unlike the other teachers labs).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I normally don't say this, but I would really avoid her if you can. EXTREMELY harsh grader, and yet still managed to over-explain EVERYTHING so we always got out late. Half the class would argue with her about her grading being weird and she still stayed the same. She's pretty rude as well and does joke around a lot. Quiz just about every week.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Her lectures are easy to understand, but she will not post her lectures. She also jokes around a lot. Her exams can be tricky, but studying the class notes a lot is all you need to do. For lab, she is a difficult grader on lab quizzes. However, she geniunely wants people to fully understand the material and have a strong foundation for biology.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Doesn't post notes online, has a thick accent, and lectures from slides that look like her personal notes. Doesn't give any idea of whats on tests, no reviews, and 3/4 of the questions on her multiple choice exams have "None of the above, all of the above or two of the above" Grade based off 3 tests and a final. No tests dropped, so don't mess up.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Probably the worst professor Ive ever had. Her tests are extremely difficult because she words them so terribly. Half of the answers are either none of the above or all of the above.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Lu frequently moved tests because she doesn't get through material quickly. Wording on her tests is quite confusing and questions contain grammar mistakes, yet she grades you on spelling. She doesn't post her PowerPoints on D2l & gives a few assignments in addition to tests. This class is okay, and easier than when I took Beach, but not great.
We didn't finish half of the coursework we were supposed to for the class we signed up for. She kind of omitted all of it from the final.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This is the worst professor I have ever had for lab. I am in my 3rd year, and I am a consistent "A" student. She was impossible. You have to word things exactly how she does or you won't pass. The quizzes are worth 90 out of 140 points. You have them every day. Prepare to stay for 3 hours EVERY SINGLE DAY.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She was okay. A little bit intimidating and it was difficult to really understand what she was looking for. Lab quizzes were pretty hard but once you get a good idea of what to expect from them they weren't too awful. Everything on the tests were straight out of the powerpoint or lab

The class tests were simple but a bit difficult due to her wording, the lab tests were impossible. She basically required you to recite the answer exactly as she saw it, sometimes the answers from the book or manuals were "wrong". Her lab lectures were so long we never once finished on time. All of the class tests come from the notes and the labs.

Hardest professor at KSU. Doesn't post on D2L so better copy down every word off powerpoint; tests are directly from notes. Asks irrelevant questions on test; you may have clear understanding of material but test will not reflect that. 11 lab quizzes, pretty much like studying for an exam everyday. IMPOSSIBLE GRADER.

By far the hardest professor at KSU. This was the last class I had to take before entering the nursing program at kennesaw (I had already been accepted into the program). I was a 4.0 student, never made a even a "B" in any science here. I struggled to get a C in this class. Went to her office all the time and she was just rude. Do not take her!

Dr. Lu is by far the hardest teacher I have had a KSU. It's not that her class is meant to be hard, but it is hard to understand exactly what it is she wants students to take with and learn from her class. Avoid her if you can because this class will just ruin your chances of getting into the nursing program, if that's why you are taking it.

If you want buid a strong foundation of knowledge to take with you to Nursing school, then she is the professor to take. It's possible to make an A if you study effectively. She has tricky test ?s that make you think so know the info. She provides sample exams to see how she tests. Try not to take at the same time as A&P. Challenging yet rewarding.

The semester is over and I am in utter shock. Im pretty sure Dr. Lu has given me PTDS. I beg you to take someone else! If she is your only choice, take Microbiology at another school. Your final grade WILL NOT reflect your work. I am an A student and I had to neglect other classes to study for a C!!! I wish I had listened to the reviews...

By far the worst Bio teacher at KSU. Her class was the only C I received in my undergraduate degree. She makes her own exams that are horribly written, misuse of words such as "past"  and "passed". She  also misspells words but if you misspell any words on quizzes or exams OR even use full sentences you will get points deducted. AVOID!!

Good points: sense of humor, exams straight from lecture, does not take attendance. Bad points: marks whole answer incorrect for spelling, lab quizzes are super hard: may mark your answer wrong and another student with the same answer gets marked correct, does not use D2L at all, no way to get copy of lecture notes online, tests are very tricky
Honestly the worst teacher at KSU. Marks off for incorrect spelling, unclear of what she wants, irrational, illogical, hard to understand, and does not care about the students she teaches. Avoid!

Pretty much the worst teacher. no access to course material. She seems to be more interested in some weird sense of disciplining students rather than helping them learn. LAB QUIZZES ARE IMPOSSIBLE!!!! I made an A on every test including the final  and she still managed to give me a B. I'd rather change my major than take her again.

This professor is blunt yet care for students. she keeps student interested by making them write the notes in the class. Her material are not wordy, breakdown of topics is good. Her exams are testing your reasonability in few words than those profes who tend to make students go through thesis before answering the question.

Dr. Lu doesn't answer questions in class at all. She doesn't post her PowerPoints nor does she use D2L. You have to keep up with your grades because they aren't posted anywhere. If you have a question about what you missed on a test/quiz she will just tell you "too bad". The test are full of double negatives to trick you. Just avoid at all cost.

I never had any teacher who hides the material (e.g. PPT etc.) what they teach in the class. This lady doesn't use any electronic avenue. Neither D2L nor her own web site to post any of the material. She is not decided in her head what she wants to do? She spends lab time in talking too much and then expect students to finish work in-time. :(((

You can't understand what she is saying because her accent is too thick. Her tests are awful because there are so many double negatives. For Lab she is awful, the quizzes are impossible. DO NOT TAKE HER!!

Terrible! Wouldn't help with questions. I studied for months for the lab final, went in and knew almost everything and because some of my wording was a TINY bit off I somehow managed to fail it with a 64! Ridiculous class. Do NOT take her!
Horrible. Don't take.

Everyone who complains about this class should switch their major.  It is extremely manageable but you do have to study.  Tests come directly from notes and she post practice tests.  Lab quizzes are difficult, but once again you need to study.  I learned a lot and I really enjoyed the class.

Dr. Lu had a hard time answering questions. She did not appreciate any type of question regarding the material and viewed such as an insult to her knowledge. She would deduct points for written answers that were practically verbatim from the text. I would NEVER take another class that she is teaching. Not recommended!

Teacher is discriminatory towards others of different religious beliefs. Won't excuse absence for high holy days and took my name off roster and told me I was no longer welcome in lab. Cares more about her research than teaching and ethics. KSU would be better off firing her and avoiding the lawsuit!! Unreasonable and unprofessional

Teacher grades non-objectively! Will tilt grading scale unfavorably towards students she doesn't personally like and grades more favorable to students she likes on short answer exams. Thick accent, hard to understand, and takes offense at questions of clarification or just any question at all.

Thick accent, very hard to understand, and takes offense at questions in reference to clarifying what she said. Doesn't like answering questions over related material either. Basically she is completely useless and hates helping students. Students must buy book, but it isn't used at all. I really don't understand why she even wants to be a teacher!

Teacher unethically advises students in wrong academic path because she doesn't personally like them. Advises A students to drop and take a class from someone who speaks the same language as them and will give unlimited time on exams. Test are timed but students are not advised on time restriction before exam. Thick accent, stubborn, and unhelpful!

Let me first say that this woman is brilliant. She knows everything! The problem is that she expects us to already know EVERYTHING. Quizzes and labs graded harshly. Tests have lots of tricks and are tough. Study Study and Study. Must go to class for notes, but I suggest you read the text because she's all over the place. Practice tests have no key.

Don't take her! She takes points off for arbitrary reasons and won't listen if you try to argue with her. The language barrier is pretty intense and her tests are mostly open-ended, so if she doesn't understand what you are saying she will just take points off. Her tests require a lot of memorization and comes from her incomprehensible notes.
Worst teacher at KSU
Not helpful at all.  very picky and hard teacher.

She's a toughie, but a good teacher.  She comes across more harsh than she really is because of her accent and way of wording things. 3 test, final can replace lowest..Stressful labss, but interesting, has unknown lab worth large portion of grade.  Very interesting and engaging class

This class was very helpful. I learned sooo much by taking this class. She is hard on the students, but if your a biology major it should be that way. Her tests are difficult your expected to know the information very well. She also gives quizzes before all the labs. But, overall she is a good teacher. The test comes exactly for the lecture notes.
She was a great teacher. Her notes are rite from her notes. and her lab quizzes are straight from the lab manuel. Go to class and u will do fine.

This class isn't bad.  The tests come straight from her notes.  You don't have to read the book, but you need to make sure to capture every detail in the notes.  Her test questions all have "one of the above" or "none of the above".  The lab quizzes are very specific, but not that bad.  You don't have to study too hard, but you have to.  Good prof.

Terrible Professor!  Could not understand her, and she was not interested in helping me.  She was too busy to help me when I did go by her office.  She curves on a D!  Just look at her grading history.  Take another prof at all costs, especially if your degree requires a "C" or better!

Yes, this class is difficult, but it's a 4000 level class. Be prepared to know many details about several specific viruses and their life cycles. Tests are tough, but not impossible. It will take a lot of work, but it is possible to make an A. Dr. Lu really knows what she's talking about, so ask questions!

Dr. Lu really knows her stuff. The class can be difficult, but it's more because there's a lot of information to cover, rather than her teaching. Go to class and write down everything from her powerpts, and you should do fine. The lab quizzes are harder than you might expect. You have to put effort into this class, but it is possible to make an A.
Do not take her. very thick accent, rude, and her test are very tough.She doesn't curve.Easy F .
